page.title: 04Environment, Sollom
page.content: Open, flat landscape, sporadic treees and woodland. Domestic buildings. Silo towers. Greenhouses. Overhead electricity pylons. Being flat and close to the west coast, the area is subject to the prevailing, westerly (wet) winds; very little snow in winter. The wildlife includes rabbits, hares, foxes, game birds and water fowl. Flora includes cow parsley, hogweed, sorrel, comfrey, bindweed, foxgloves and eye bright. Pleasant walks along the riverside and canal towpath, but in general the use of public footpaths tends to be decreasing.
